nodes.description: The first bombing occurred at a police training ground north of Kabul during a campaign rally for Afghan President Ashraf Ghani, killing at least 26 and injuring more than 30.
Later, the Taliban took credit for another bombing near Kabul’s ‘Green Zone’, killing at least 22 and injuring at least 38.
The attacks came a week after President Donald Trump declared peace talks with the Taliban ‘dead’ and highlighted the stakes in those talks.
The Taliban has vowed to disrupt Afghanistan’s upcoming elections, which are currently scheduled for September 28.
The Afghan government has not been involved in the US-Taliban peace talks and has been critical of them.
The Taliban views the current Afghan administration as illegitimate and has complained about the lack of commitment to a ceasefire in the negotiations.
